Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2008 12:16PM CandyLuna wrote: Hello all, just got home last night, first week over! Since i live 2 and a half hours away, have to stay in motel over in Galveston all week and then come home on Fridays. Missed my 2 girls so much and of course hubby, didn't miss the cooking and cleaning, lol. Took my 3 year old with me. Did chemo on Monday and radiation all week. There doing radiation on my spine area, so not sure what to expect, but so far, just been getting more exhausted as the days go by. Port is making me uncomfortable, used to sleeping on belly, now it seems i can't breathe. Probably all in my head. Sure good to here from you all, so far the people i've had to communicate with, drs. receptionsists, etc. have been pretty good! I don't know why people have to be so rude sometimes, especially when they have to work with people all day.  Quick question, what is Tamox? Sue, thank you for keeping me in your prayers, every one of you is special in your own way, and i will be thinking of you all as i go another week. Good luck and Be Strong, thats me, the crybaby talking! LOL.
Posts.Title: Looking for a February Rad Team debbbyb twirlgirl

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2008 06:19PM CandyLuna wrote: Hello all, just finished packing to get ready to leave for my 3rd week of rads.  Was reading all about what to eat and not, its funny, but my radiologist told me stay away from fruits and vegetables, spicy foods, and then my oncologist turns around and says eat all you want and can. ??? I'm not taking any medications right now, onc. took me off of steroids because blood pressure was going up to high, i take my pills for nausea the first 3 days and also benadryl, but the rest of the week, i don't take anything. Right now i'm having pain on my left side because of my port, i think because i can't sleep on my back, i sleep on my stomach, all my weight is there. Will keep all of you in my thoughts and prayers and will check in when i come home on Friday. One quick question is Taxotere the same as Tamoxifen?

Posts.Title: Looking for a February Rad Team debbbyb twirlgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2008 11:12AM CandyLuna wrote: Hi Michelle, i just finished 15 treatments of radiation to my L3 and L5 last Friday, i was told it would give me diarrhea as it would be hitting my small bowel, but i didn't get diarrhea, i was more constipated if anything. Sorry to hear your mom has to go through this, but i hope it helps. I have two tumors on spine and hopefully this helped, i was also getting chemo once a week for those 3 weeks (taxotere) so its hard to tell what side effects came from what. Now i start A/C in April, oncologist gave me a 4 week vacation. I was diagnosed in December with b/c, after all tests, found out it mestasized to bones, so radiation was for that, now we start treatments for the breast cancer and then see if mastectomy is still needed after A/C. Will keep your mom in prayers!

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2008 01:27PM CandyLuna wrote: Hi all, I was diagnosed on December 13th of last year, had lump on right breast for about 3 years and finally got financial help so went to check out, came back it was cancerous, lymph nodes positive, don't know how many, i think 3, anyways went for all usual test, cat scan blood work, colonoscopy, cat scan showed a suspicious mass on my spine. I have been having these terrible pains on my pelvic area that goes down to my legs, can't even bend over sometimes or I pee on myself, lol, well got scheduled for a bone scan this past Tuesday, just got results this morning mass was cancerous on spine, another suspicious mass on my skull, but Dr. said we are not going to worry about that right now. I was scheduled for a mastectomy, but all is put on hold for now, so we can take care of this tumor on spine, my question is to all is why am i going to do radiation first?  Is this stronger than the chemo? Forgot to tell all, dr. said she wants to do 7 to 12 days of radiation, if spot on skull gets smaller with radiation, then thats probably cancer too! Any input on this will be greatly appreciated. I am from Texas and going to UTMB in Galveston. Hugs to all.
Posts.Title: Anyone starting Rads in January? Barbie7 Miss_Lolli

Posts.Content: CandyLuna wrote: I have posted several times since being diagnosed, but just wondering why some of us get chemo before the mastectomy, while i read that some get the mastectomy right away. I was diagnosed back in December and my cancer has mestasized to my spine, don't have any pain yet, but they did find two masses on spine and just assumed it was cancer. I am Stage 1V. Done 15 treatments of radiation to spine and 4 rounds of Taxotere, will be starting A/C this coming week. Another ?  Why some get Taxotere first, i've read alot of posts, alot get the A/C first. Any advice would be greatly appreciated I will fight and survive this disease! Dx 12/13/2007, IDC, Stage IV, 1/21 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
